intro: Cymopterus elrodii, commonly known as the Elrod's evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Cymopterus elrodii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with well-drained soils.
